works.description: For over 100 million school children in India, computers are a far-fetched dream, as they don’t have electricity in their schools. The scenario might soon change as researchers at Rice University and Singapore’s Nanyang Tech University have developed a prototype tablet PC that runs on solar energy. Dubbed the I-Slate, the device is being claimed to be the first of a series of electronic notepads that use low-energy-consumption microchips, enabling the system to run on electricity generated by solar panels
